definition: to capture
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
generic term for birds and animals/birds/to capture (old)
to apprehend/to capture/to seize
hands tied and waiting to be captured
to capture alive
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
to be taken prisoner
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
(jocularly) Valentine's Day, referring to the rising number of extramarrital affairs being discovered on that day

sentences.english: The balance roller receives the impulses from the pallets via its impulse-pin.
sentences.chinese: 摆轮滚轴通过冲击销来接收擒纵叉的冲击。

sentences.english: "Honey" won Golden Bear award in Berlin International Film Festival successfully.
sentences.chinese: 《蜂蜜》柏林电影节爆冷成功擒金熊奖。

sentences.english: Clock trap dourgen to enter into a trap, DuoDuo captured.
sentences.chinese: 娜木钟用计让多尔衮进入陷阱，多铎被擒。

sentences.english: Because the Grab Bar ends pivot and rotate, the installation options are endless.
sentences.chinese: 因为擒抱杆两端轴和旋转，安装选项是无穷无尽的。

sentences.english: If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can constrict.
sentences.chinese: 如果它通过了擒抱鉴定，它确定抓住并能够使用压缩。

sentences.english: The star escapement wheel is an important part in this organ.
sentences.chinese: 星状擒纵轮是该机构中重要零件。

sentences.english: In the same way the sixth king was captured.
sentences.chinese: 同样地第六位国王也被擒了。
